data.title: Goo choice
data.text: Good food staff and ribs are really good u get alot for 9 bucks to anyone i would say if u love ribs go here

data.title: Ribs
data.text:
Ribs fall of bone
I think on appetizer menu
Decent staff once engaged
Get extra napkins from the start

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Love this casual place in the Battle House. Delicious pizzas, yummy salads and spups...and sandwiches.....everything is tasty! And great atmosphere.  Right around the corner from The Listening Room and walking distance to the Crescent Theater.  One of my favorite spots before music or a movie...or just dinner!

data.title: Delicious and Fresh
data.text: Pull up a seat and watch the game, the weather, the news and another game. There are tvs everywhere. We ordered the hummus for a appetizer and thought it the best we have ever had. Covered in feta cheese, tomatoes and served with hot fresh pitas. We highly recommend. We shared a pizza for our main entree and had plenty for two with leftovers. The crust was delicious and the topping and cheese were high quality. Check out Joe Cains. It won't disappoint.

data.title: Overall it's OK, I'm not sure I'd be back.
data.text:
We were staying in the hotel, and since the hotel bar was closed we came here around 2pm.  Overall I would say it's OK, but there is better to be had in Mobile.
The drinks were decent, and there is a good selection.  My wife did not like the hurricane she ordered, but the rest of our party seemed relatively happy.  We also ordered nachos which were decent, but again nothing worth coming back for.  After a long hot day, it was nice to get into the A/C and enjoy some food and drinks, and the location is very easy to get to.  Other than that, it's a bar which serves some bar food.

College football was on and there were lots of TVs, which is always a plus.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at Joe Cain Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear MarkUSNA1998,

Thank you for sharing your experiences with me from your recent visit to the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  Thank your for stopping into Joe Cain Café and sharing your feedback with us!  I apologize that your wife did not enjoy her Hurricane drink, but I was glad to hear that everything else was to your satisfaction.  I hope that you will visit the Joe Cain Café again in the future next time your travels bring you back to the hotel.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good for drinks
data.text:
Came here for a quick drink. Bartender made us both cocktails at a good price. Had live music in the late afternnon and has a nice feel to the place.

Is attached to a wonderful hotel but you didn't need to be staying there to come to this cafe- bar.

We ordered the pepperoni pizza- was very large but mostly cheese and luckily to get a piece of peppering on a huge slice- so we would not order pizza from them again as found very bland.

Come here for drinks though and maybe other food is better.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The bar was nice. The pizza seemed more like a pub food. Waitress nice. Nothing special. Would go back for a drink but not to eat.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at Joe Cain Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Carla K,  

Thank you for stopping in and dining with us at the Battle House Hotel & Spa in Joe Cain Cafe!  I appreciate your business and feedback.  I'm glad you enjoyed the bar during your visit.  I do apologize that the pizza did not meet your expectations.  I do hope you stop in again real soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great quick snack and coffee
data.text: Service was excellent. The staff was really friendly and on task. The coffee and tea was hot and delicious.  They run daily specials and have a good variety on their menu. Pizza was thin crust and delicious. I would definitely return.

data.title: Fun atmosphere, great menu variety
data.text: I always eat here at least once on a Mobile trip, and I've never had a bad meal.  It's a great place for lunch. This time, I had a chicken, bacon and tomato pita.  It was obvious the chicken breast was freshly cooked, and the ranch dressing was a nice change from mayo. The staff easily handled our large group of noisy friends.

data.title: Good place for a quick bite!
data.text: I eat here each time I stay in Mobile. Good food and atmosphere. We had a wonderful waitress on our last visit. She was so nice and was quick to bring us what we needed. I have never had a bad experience or meal here.

data.title: Good food quick!
data.text: Had an hour break during a conference at the Battle House and this place is located inside the hotel but you can also enter from the street. I ordered the spinach and chicken pizza and it was more than I expected for $14. I had it for lunch, dinner, and lunch again!  Still tasted great reheated in oven.

data.title: Great Place to Meet for pre-dinner Cocktails
data.text: A quick stop for cocktails before a night in downtown Mobile. The service was great and it was very convenient as we were staying in the hotel

data.title: Terrible at all levels
data.text:
The food was either bland or inedible (gumbo).  The service was non existent and the wait for everything was forever.  The singer was great.  The food and beverage director should spend a little time here.  The Battle House Marriot needs to pay attention.
My first bad review but so deserved.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at Joe Cain Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear upisland,

Thank you for visiting Joe Cain Cafe at the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  I appreciate your business, but more importantly, your feedback.  I apologize that you found the food bland and the gumbo inedible and a lack of service during your visit.  I have forwarded your feedback to the Director of Outlets for their review and immediate follow up.   This type of service and quality of food is not up to our standards and will get corrected.  

Again, my sincere apologies and thank you for your feedback.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: would not recommend
data.text: I ordered a chicken salad sandwich and iced tea here.  The sandwich consisted of mostly mayonnaise and the iced tea was so bitter that it was difficult to even drink it.  Really an awful experience.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at Joe Cain Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Donna B,

Thank you for sharing your feedback from your recent to Joe Cain Café.  I apologize that your sandwich and drink were unsatisfactory.  I have forwarded your feedback to the Director of Outlets and Culinary Team to ensure that this is addressed immediately to prevent this poor quality in the future.  I appreciate you bringing this to my attention so that we may follow up and correct for future visits.  

Again, my apologies.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasant Surprise for a Hotel Restaurant
data.text: I usually avoid hotel restaurants.  I tried this restaurant for convenience and watched local business folks making their way quickly here for lunch.  So I decided to follow.  The service was excellent.  I ordered the iced tea for my beverage.  It was a tropical ice tea and was refreshing.  For lunch I went for the pimento cheese BLT.  It was served with pepper jelly which I ordered on the side.  The reason I ordered it on the side was to avoid under or over use of the sweetness.  I added very little of the pepper jelly and it gave the sandwich a favorable sweet taste that complimented the pimento cheese.  The sandwich is made with a pita rather than brad which turned out to be a great combination.  I chose the pasta salad for the side rather than potato chips or fruit salad.  It was very good the pasta was el dente.  I will be back for more.

data.title: ood eats!!
data.text: I had there 16 ich pizza, boy it was good but I could not finnish all of it. At the time I was there they had live music that was pretty good to listen too. I was sure to leave a good tip for my waitress...

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised - great lunch!
data.text: I must admit I didn't have super high expectations for a coffee shop / lunch spot in a hotel lobby.  Wow - was I wrong!  The lunch was excellent.  The chicken salad was freshly made and delicious - best I've ever had.  My colleague had a chicken caesar wrap and also raved about how delicious it was.  The accompanying fruit was very fresh and tasty.

data.title: pimento & cheese BLT- Oh MY!!
data.text: Who would think that a pimento & cheese BLT would make someone want to return to Mobile for that reason alone! This sandwich is served on pita bread with pepper jelly. All I can say is WOW!  Great service at this little restaurant as well.

data.title: Good place to relax at hotel
data.text: Wait staff excellent, especially Elizabeth. We went there a couple times during our visit and she remembered us and our preferences. First day she went to other restaurant in hotel (even though closed) to get me a dessert.  Menu is a bit limited, but enough to find something to go with your beverage; food was a bit above average for a bar, but very relaxing and didn't have to leave the hotel.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: This restaurant is right there next to the hotel.  You don't have to go outside to enter.  Great place to go and unwind after a work day or just arriving from your trip.  A variety of drinks and food items to choose from and very good prices.
